I am very pleased to see my colleagues on the Energy and Commerce Committee taking steps today to address the pressing needs of our AV stakeholders and working to ensure that the U.S. remains a global leader in this technology.

We must update our laws while maintaining safety and accountability in AV operation or risk being boxed out of an emerging market at a time when we are already playing catch-up on semiconductor and EV manufacturing.

It is therefore critical to establish a robust legal and regulatory framework to sustain and secure America’s continued leadership in AVs by modernizing our regulatory environment to accelerate innovation, drive growth, and enhance safety for  American motorists writ large.
Autonomous vehicles (AVs) can increase safety, boost productivity, contribute to economic growth and job opportunities, reduce carbon emissions, and enhance transportation access to all Americans.
